Authors: Xiang-Hua Wang, Annemieke Verbeken, Jorinde Nuytinck
Title:
Lactarius vividus sp. nov. (Russulaceae, Russulales), a
widely distributed edible mushroom in central and southern China
Abstract:
Lactarius sect. Deliciosi is a group of edible mushrooms
with a worldwide geographical distribution. Several species are
considered choice edible mushrooms. Taxonomic knowledge on this group in
Asia is still fragmentary. A new species with orange latex, L. vividus,
is described in this section. It is an important wild edible mushroom,
widely distributed in central and southern China, but for a long time it
was either not distinguished from its lookalikes or left unnamed or
misidentified. Morphological analyses demonstrate that this species
encompasses high infra-specific morphological variation, which makes it
hard to clearly delimit its boundaries. Compared with the other species
having orange latex in the same section, this species can be mostly
recognized by the vividly colored, sub-distant to distant lamellae and
heavy spore ornamentation. It has been found to grow with four pine
trees of Pinus subg. Pinus including P. latteri, P. massoniana, P.
taiwanensis and P. thunbergii. Phylogenetic analyses on ITS regions and
glyceraldehyde-3-phophate dehydrogenase gene sequences support the
species delimitation and suggest the two genes to be good markers to
identify this new species readily.
